intro: Pedicularis pseudokaroi, commonly known as the purple monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to deep purple. It typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky areas, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
